course.subject: PHYS
course.name: Capstone Research
course.description: Under the supervision of a faculty member, students will complete an independent capstone research project. The course is extended over two regular terms. By the end of the course, students need to summarize their results in the form of a short thesis and perform oral presentation. For PHYS students under the four-year degree only. Enrollment in the course requires approval by course instructors and supervisors. May be graded PP.
course.prerequisites: PHYS 3152 AND PHYS 3153

reviews.author: Eleanor444
reviews.comment_content: In this course, you will carry out independent research under the supervision of a faculty member in the Physics Department. The course lasts for one year (i.e., you need to enroll in both fall and spring terms) and carries 6 credits (3 credits in each term). You must identify a faculty member, who is willing to supervise your research on a topic jointly determined by you and your supervisor.  At the end of the fall term, you need to give an oral presentation and submit a written progress report describing the results of your research obtained so far. At the end of the spring term, you will need to give an oral presentation and submit a final project report describing the final results of your research.
reviews.comment_teaching:
No teaching. The lecture will explain the grading scheme and report+presentation requirement.

Lecture 1: Grading scheme

Lecture 2: Presentation requirement

Lecture 3: Report requirement
reviews.comment_grading:
Fall term

(i) (15%) Oral presentation (10 minutes presentation plus 5 minutes questions) for each student to be held near the end of the Fall term.

(ii) (20%) Fall term progress report of 5 pages to be submitted to your supervisor and course instructor(s) near the end of the Fall term.

Spring term

(iii) (30%) Final project report of  8 pages to be submitted to your supervisor and course instructor(s) near the end of the Spring term.

(iv) (15%) Oral presentation (10 minutes presentation plus 5 minutes questions) for each student to be held near the end of the Spring term.

(v) (20%) Research performance for both terms to be given by your supervisor.

All students need to attend the presentation session of your classmates in PHYS 4291, and you need to give a grade to each presenter. Each presentation lasts for 10 minutes plus 5 minutes for questions from the audience. The grade of your oral presentation will be jointly determined by your supervisor, course instructor(s) and TA/IAs. Late report will be deducted 10% of the report grade per day late until 0% (so if you turn in your report 10 days later, your grade for that report will be 0).
reviews.comment_workload:
Following the University guideline on course credits, you should meet with your supervisor once a week and the workload for each semester is 9 hrs per week.

Friend's experience: go to lab 3 times a week.
